original: samantapāsādikavivaraṇaṃ, catubhāṇavāraṭṭhakathā vivaraṇaṃ, abhidhammasaṅgahavivaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: samantapāsādika vivaraṇam catu bhāṇa vāra ṭṭhakathā vivaraṇam abhidhamma saṅgaha vivaraṇam
translated: the Samantapāsādikavivaraṇa, the commentary on the Catubhāṇavāra-aṭṭhakathā, the commentary on the Abhidhamma-saṅgaha,

original: saccasaṅkhepavivaraṇaṃ, saddatthabhedacintāvivaraṇaṃ, saddavuttivivaraṇaṃ, kaccāyanasāravivaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: sacca saṅkhepa vivaraṇam saddattha bheda cintā vivaraṇam sadda vutti vivaraṇam kaccāyana sāra vivaraṇam
translated: the commentary on the Saccasaṅkhepa, the commentary on the Saddatthabhedacintā, the commentary on the Saddavutti, the commentary on the Kaccāyanasāra,

original: kaccāyanavivaraṇaṃ, abhidhammasaṅgahassaṭīkāvivaraṇaṃ, mahāvessantarajātakassa vivaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: kaccāyana vivaraṇam abhidhammasaṅgahassa ṭīkā vivaraṇam mahāvessantara jātakassa vivaraṇam
translated: the commentary on the Kaccāyana, the commentary on the commentary on the Abhidhamma-saṅgaha, the commentary on the Mahāvessantara-jātaka,

original: sakkābhimataṃ, mahāvessantarajātakassa navaṭṭhakathā, paṭhama-sambodhi ca lokanetti,
analyzed: sakka abhimatam mahā vessantara jātakassa nava ṭṭhakathā paṭhama sambodhi ca
translated: the Sakkābhimata, the commentary on the Mahāvessantara-jātaka called the Navaṭṭhakathā, the Paṭhama-sambodhi of the Leader of the World,

original: buddhaghosācariyanidānaṃ, milinda-pañho vaṇṇanā, caturārakkhā, caturārakkhāyaaṭṭhakathā,
analyzed: buddha ghosācariya nidānam milinda pañhaḥ vaṇṇanā caturārakkhā caturārakkhāya aṭṭhakathā
translated: the Buddhaghosācariyanidāna, the commentary on the Milinda-pañha, the Caturārakkhā, the commentary on the Caturārakkhā,

original: saddavuttippakaraṇassa navaṭīkā cāti imāni, ticattālīsa pakaraṇāni attano matiyā
analyzed: saddavutti pakaraṇassa nava ṭīkā ca ati imāni ticattālīsa pakaraṇāni attanaḥ matiyā
translated: and the Nine Commentaries on the Saddavutti, these forty-three Commentaries were composed by him in the various countries of Laṅkā, etc.,

original: sāsanassa jātiyā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā ca laṅkādīpādīsu viṃsu viṃsu katāni.
analyzed: sāsanassa jātiyā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā ca laṅkā dīpa ādīsu viṃsu viṃsu katāni
translated: in order to preserve the true Dhamma and to show the age of the Dispensation.

original: Sambuddhe gāthā ca…pe… navahāraguṇavaṇṇanā cāti ime buddhapaṇāmādikā gāthāyo. Attano
analyzed: sambuddhe gāthā cape nava hāra guṇa vaṇṇanā ca ati ime buddha paṇāma ādikāḥ gāthāyaḥ attano
translated: The verses of praise to the Sambuddha, etc., and the description of the nine qualities of the Buddha, these verses of praise to the Buddha, etc.,🔽were composed by the wise in the various countries of Laṅkā, etc.,

original: attano buddhaguṇapakāsanatthāya attano ca pare ca anantapaññāpavattanatthāya ca paṇḍitehi🔽laṅkādīpādīsu viṃsu viṃsu katā.
analyzed: attano buddha guṇa pakāsana tthāya attano ca pare ca ananta paññā pavattana tthāya ca paṇḍitehi  laṅkā dīpa ādīsu viṃsu viṃsu katā
translated: in order to show the qualities of the Buddha and to make known their own and others’ infinite wisdom.

original: [Iti culla-ganthavaṃse āyācakācariyadīpako nāma catuttho paricchedo.]
analyzed: iti cullagantha vaṃse āyācakācariyadīpakaḥ nāma catuttho paricchedo
translated: [Thus ends the fourth chapter in the Cullavagga of the Jinakālamālī, called Āyācakācariyadīpa.]

original: 5. Pakiṇṇaka-paricchedo
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka paricchedaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Miscellaneous Matters

original: Nāmaṃ āropanaṃ potthakaṃ ganthakārassa ca. Lekhaṃlekhāpanañceva, vadāmi tadanantaranti.
analyzed: nāmam āropanam potthakam ganthakārassa ca lekham lekhāpanam ca iva vadāmi tad anantaram ti
translated: The naming, the binding, the book, the author, the writing, and the writing down, I shall tell of these next.

original: Tattha caturāsītiyā dhammakkhandhasahassāni piṭaka, nikāyaṅga, vagga, nipātādikaṃ
analyzed: tattha caturāsītiyā dhammakkhandha sahassāni
translated: Herein, the four hundred and eighty thousand parts of the Dhamma are called the Piṭaka, the Nikāya, the Aṅga, the Vagga, the Nipāta, etc.,

original: nāmaṃ, kenāropitaṃ, kattha āropitaṃ, kadā āropitaṃ, kimatthaṃ āropitanti? Tatrāyaṃ
analyzed: nāmam kena āropitam katthas āropitam kadā āropitam kimattham āropitam tatra ayam
translated: “By whom was the name applied? Where was it applied? When was it applied? For what purpose was it applied?”

original: pivisajjanākena āropitanti pañcasatakhīṇāsavehi āropitaṃ. Tehi sabbabuddhavacanaṃ
analyzed: āropitanti pañca sata khīṇāsavehi āropitam tehi sabba buddha vacanam
translated: Herein, it was applied by the compilers. It was applied by the five hundred perfected ones. They were compiling all the Buddha’s words,🔽saying, “This is the Piṭaka, this is the Nikāya, this is the Aṅga, this is the Vagga, this is the Nipāta.”

original: saṅgāyanti, idaṃ piṭakaṃ, ayaṃ nikāyo, idaṃ aṅgaṃ, ayaṃ vaggo, ayaṃ nipātoti. Evamādikaṃ
analyzed: saṅgāyanti idam piṭakam ayam nikāyaḥ idam aṅgam ayam vaggo ayam nipāto ti evamādikam
translated: They applied the name beginning in this way.

original: nāmaṃ āropenti. Kattha āropitanti? Rājagahe vebhārapabbatassa pāde dhammamaṇḍappe
analyzed: nāmam āropenti kattha āropitanti rājagahe vebhārapabbatassa pāde dhammamaṇḍappe
translated: Where was it applied? It was applied in Rājagaha, at the foot of the mountain called Vebhāra, in the Dhamma hall.

original: āropitaṃ. Kadā āropitanti? Bhagavato parinibbute paṭhamasaṅgāyanakāle āropitaṃ. Kimatthaṃ
analyzed: āropitam kadā āropitanti bhagavataḥ parinibbute paṭhama saṅgāyana kāle āropitam kimattham
translated: When was it applied? It was applied at the time of the first recitation after the Lord’s final attainment of Nibbāna.

original: āropitanti? Dhammakkhandhānaṃ vohārasukhatthāya sukhadhāraṇatthāya ca āropitaṃ. Saṅgītikāle
analyzed: āropitam ti dhamma kkhandhānam vohāra sukha atthāya sukha dhāraṇa tthāya ca āropitam saṅgīti kāle
translated: For what purpose was it applied? It was applied for the sake of ease in communicating the divisions of the True Idea and for the sake of ease in memorizing them.🔽At the time of the recitation

original: pañcasatā khīṇāsavā tesañca dhammakkhandhānaṃ nāma vagganipātato. Imassa dhammakkhandhassa
analyzed: pañca satā khīṇāsavā tesam ca dhammakkhandhānam nāma vagga nipātataḥ imassa dhammakkhandhassa
translated: the five hundred perfected ones gave the name, the Vagga, and the Nipāta to those divisions of the True Idea.

original: ayaṃ nāmo hotu, imassa ca pakaraṇassa ayaṃ nāmoti, abravuṃ sabbaṃ nāmādikaṃ kiccaṃ
analyzed: ayam nāmaḥ hotu imassa ca pakaraṇassa ayam nāma iti abravum sabbam nāma ādikam kiccam
translated: They said, “Let the name of this division of the True Idea be this, and let the name of this treatise be this,” and so they did all the work of naming and so on.

original: akaṃsu. Te khīṇāsavā, yadi nāmādikaṃ kiccaṃ akataṃ na supākataṃ tasmā vohārasukhatthāyanāmādikaṃ
analyzed: te khīṇa āsavāḥ yadi nāma ādikam kiccam akatam na supākatam tasmā vohāra sukhatthāya nāma ādikam
translated: and they did so. If the work of naming, etc., had not been done well, then for the sake of ease in usage

original: kiccaṃ kataṃ anāgate panatthāya nāmādikaṃ pavattitaṃ asañjātanāmo na suṭṭhu pākato
analyzed: kiccam katam anāgate pana atthāya nāma ādikam pavattitam a sañjāta nāmaḥ na suṭṭhu pākato
translated: the work of naming, etc., would have been done again in the future. But since the work of naming, etc., was done well, it is not necessary to do it again.

original: sabbaso bhaveti. Dhammakkhandhānaṃ nāma dīpanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sabbasas bhaveti dhammakkhandhānam nāma dīpanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the aggregates of Dhamma is finished.

original: Caturāsīti dhammakkhandhasahassāni kena potthake āropitāni, kadā āropitāni, kimatthaṃ
analyzed: caturāsīti dhammakkhandha sahassāni kena potthake āropitāni kadā āropitāni kimattham
translated: By whom were the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dhamma written down? When were they written down? For what purpose were they written down?

original: āropitānīti. Tatrāyaṃ visajjanā kenāropitāniti? Khīṇāsavamahānāgehi āropitāni. Kattha🔽āropitānīti? Laṅkādīpe āropitāni. Kadā āropitānīti? Saddhātissassarājino puttassa
analyzed: āropitāni iti tatra ayam visajjanā kena āropitāni iti khīṇāsava mahā nāgehi āropitāni kattha  āropitāni iti laṅkā dīpe āropitāni kadā āropitāni iti saddhātissassa rājino puttassa
translated: Here is the answer: By whom were they written down? They were written down by the great Nāgas whose cankers were destroyed. Where were they written down?🔽They were written down in the Island of Laṅkā. When were they written down? They were written down at the time of King Vaṭṭagāmani,

original: vaṭṭagāmani rājassa kāle āropitāni. Kimatthaṃ āropitānīti? Dhammakkhandhānaṃ avidhaṃsanatthāya
analyzed: vaṭṭa gāmani rājassa kāle āropitāni kimattham āropitāni iti dhamma kkhandhānaṃ a vidhaṃsana tthāya
translated: the son of King Saddhātissa. For what purpose were they written down? They were written down for the purpose of preventing the aggregates of Dhamma from being lost

original: saddhammaṭṭhitiyā ca āropitāni.
analyzed: saddhamma ṭṭhitiyā ca āropitāni
translated: and for the purpose of establishing the true Dhamma.

original: Dharamāno hi bhagavā, amhākaṃ sugatodhīro;
analyzed: dharamānaḥ hi bhagavān amhākam sugataḥ dhīraḥ
translated: The Blessed One, our Supreme Sage, is still present,

original: Nikāye pañcadeseti, yāva nibbānagamanā.
analyzed: nikāye pañca deseti yāva nibbāna gamanā
translated: The five Nikāyas, and so on, down to the attainment of Nibbāna.

original: Sabbepi te bhikkhu ādi, manasā vacasāhāro;
analyzed: sabbe pi te bhikkhu ādi manasā vacasā āhāro
translated: All those monks, at the beginning, with mind and speech, with food;

original: Sabbe ca vācuggatā honti, mahāpaññāsativarā.
analyzed: sabbe ca vācuggatāḥ honti mahā paññāsati varā
translated: And all were of pure speech, of great wisdom and mindfulness.

original: Nibbūte lokanāthamhi, tato vassasataṃ bhave;
analyzed: nibbūte lokanāthamhi tatas vassa satam bhave
translated: When the Lord of the World had attained Nibbāna, then for a hundred years,

original: Ariyānariyā cāpi ca, sabbe vācuggatā dhuvaṃ.
analyzed: ariya anariyā ca api ca sabbe vācuggatāḥ dhuvam
translated: Both noble and ignoble, all were always of pure speech.

original: Tato paraṃ aṭṭharasaṃ, dvisataṃvassa gaṇanaṃ;
analyzed: tato param aṭṭharasam gaṇanaṃ
translated: After that, for eighteen hundred years, the calculation of years;

original: Sabbe puthujjanā ceva, ariyā ca sabbepite.
analyzed: sabbe puthujjanā ca iva ariyā ca
translated: All were ordinary people, and all were noble.

original: Manasāvacasāyeva, vācuggatāva sabbadā;
analyzed: sabbadā
translated: Only with mind and speech, always of pure speech;

original: Duṭṭhagāmaṇirañño ca, kāle vācuggatā dhuvaṃ.
analyzed: ca kāle dhuvam
translated: And at the time of King Duṭṭhagāmani, pure speech was always.

original: Ariyānariyāpi ca, nikāye dhāraṇāsadā;
analyzed: ariya anariyā api ca nikāye dhāraṇā sadā
translated: Both noble and ignoble, in the Nikāyas always mindful;

original: Tato paramhi rājā ca, tato cuto ca tusite.
analyzed: rājā ca tatas ca tusite
translated: After that, the king, and then passed away in Tusita.

original: Uppajji deva loke so, devehi parivārito;
analyzed: uppajji deva loke saḥ devehi parivāritaḥ
translated: He was reborn in the deva world, surrounded by devas;

original: Saddhā tissoti nāmena, tassa kaniṭṭhako hito.
analyzed: saddhā tissā tissaḥ ti nāmena tassa kaniṭṭhakaḥ hitaḥ
translated: By the name of Saddhātissa, the younger brother of the benefactor.

original: Tato laddharaṭṭho hoti, buddhasāsanapālako.
analyzed: tatas laddha raṭṭhaḥ hoti buddha sāsana pālako
translated: Then he obtained the kingdom, the protector of the Buddha's Dispensation.

original: Tadā kāle bhikkhū āsuṃ, sabbe vācuggatā sadā;
analyzed: tadā kāle bhikkhū āsum sabbe vācuggatā sadā
translated: At that time there were monks, all always of pure speech;

original: Nikāye pañcavedheva, yāva rañño ca dhāraṇā;
analyzed: nikāye pañca vedhā iva yāva rañño ca dhāraṇā
translated: The five Nikāyas alone, down to the king's mindfulness;

original: Tato cuto so rājā ca, tussīte upapajjati;
analyzed: tatas cutaḥ saḥ rājā ca tussīte upapajjati
translated: After he had passed away, that king, having been reborn in Tusita,

original: Devalokeṭṭhito santo, tadā vācuggatā tato.
analyzed: deva loka iṭṭhitaḥ santaḥ tadā tatas
translated: was the chief of the gods, and then the words were uttered.

original: Tassa puttāpi ahesuṃ, anekā varajjaṃ gatā;
analyzed: tassa puttā api ahesum anekāḥ varajjam gatā
translated: His sons also were many, who had gone to the royal city;

original: Anukkamena cutate, devalokaṃ gatā dhuvaṃ;
analyzed: anukkamena cutate deva lokam gatāḥ dhuvam
translated: in due order they passed away, and certainly went to the god-world;

original: Tadāpite sabbe bhikkhū, vācuggatāva sabbadā;
analyzed: sabbe bhikkhū sabbadā
translated: then all the monks, at that time, were always the words uttered;

original: Nikāye pañcavidheva, dhāraṇāvasatimatā.
analyzed: nikāye pañcavidhā iva dhāraṇā vasatimatā
translated: in the five Nikāyas, they were the limit of the knowledge of the Dhamma.

original: Tato paraṃ potthakesu, nikāyā pañca piṭṭhitā;🔽Tadā aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā, sabbe ganthā potthake gatā;
analyzed: tato param potthakesu nikāyā pañca piṭṭhitā  tadā aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā sabbe ganthā potthake gatā
translated: After that, in the books, the five Nikāyas were written down;🔽at that time the commentaries and sub-commentaries, all the texts were in the books.

original: Sabbe potthesu ye ganthā, pāḷi aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā;
analyzed: sabbe potthesu ye ganthā pāḷi aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā
translated: All the texts in the books, the Tipiṭaka, the commentaries and sub-commentaries,

original: Saṃṭṭhitāsaṃ ṭhitā honti, sabbepi no na santite.
analyzed: ṭhitāḥ honti sabbe pi no na santi te
translated: were established, and all of them were not lost.

original: Tadā te potthakeyeva, nikāyā piṭhitā khilā;
analyzed: tadā te potthakā iya iva nikāyā piṭhitā khilā
translated: At that time the books themselves, the Nikāyas and the Khuddaka,

original: Tadā aṭṭhakathādīni, bhavantīti vadanti ca.
analyzed: tadā aṭṭhakathā ādīni bhavanti iti vadanti ca
translated: at that time the commentaries and so on, they say, were in existence.

original: Parihāro paṇḍitehi vattabbova;🔽Laṅkādīpassa raññova, saddhā tissassa rājino.
analyzed: parihāraḥ paṇḍitehi vattabbaḥ uva  laṅkā dīpassa raññā uva saddhā tissassa rājinaḥ
translated: The learned ones should explain this.🔽The faith of the king of Laṅkā, the king named Tissa,

original: Puttako laṅkādīpassa, issaro dhammiko varo;
analyzed: puttako laṅkā dīpassa issaraḥ dhammikaḥ varo
translated: the son of the king of Laṅkā, the righteous excellent lord,

original: Tadā khīṇāsavā sabbe, olokenti anagate.
analyzed: tadā khīṇa āsavā sabbe olokenti anagate
translated: at that time all the arahats, looked into the future.

original: Khīṇāsavā passanti te, dupaññeva puthujjane;
analyzed: khīṇa āsavā passanti te dupaññā iva puthujjane
translated: The Arahants saw them, but not the ignorant worldlings.

original: Sabbepi te bhikkhū āsuṃ, bahuṃtarā puthujjanā;🔽Na sakkhissanti te pañca, nikāye vācuggataṃ iti;
analyzed: sabbe api te bhikkhū āsum bahuṃtarāḥ puthujjanāḥ  na sakkhissanti te pañca nikāye vācuggatam iti
translated: All those monks were Arahants, but there were many more worldlings.🔽They could not put the five Nikāyas into written form.

original: Potthakesu sabbe pañca, āropenti khīṇāsavā.
analyzed: potthakesu sabbe pañca āropenti khīṇa āsavā
translated: But the Arahants put them into books.

original: Saddhammaṭṭhiti cirattāya, janānaṃ puññatthāya ca;🔽Tato paṭṭhāyate sabbe, nikāyā honti potthake;
analyzed: saddhamma ṭṭhiti cirattāya janānam puññatthāya ca  tatas paṭṭhāyate sabbe nikāyāḥ honti potthake
translated: For the sake of the long duration of the true Dhamma and for the merit of the people,🔽from that time on all the Nikāyas were in books.

original: Aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā sabbe, te honti potthakeṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā sabbe te honti potthaka iṭṭhitā
translated: All the commentaries and subcommentaries were also put into books.

original: Tato paṭṭhāyate sabbe, bhikkhu ādi mahāgaṇā;
analyzed: tato paṭṭhāyate sabbe bhikkhu ādi mahā gaṇā
translated: From that time on all the monks, the great assemblies,

original: Potthakesu ṭhiteyeva, sabbe passanti sabbadā.
analyzed: potthakesu ṭhitā iya iva sabbe passanti sabbadā
translated: saw them all, as long as the books remained.

original: [Potthake āropana dīpakā niṭṭhitā.]🔽Yo koci paṇḍito dhīro, aṭṭhakathādikaṃ ganthaṃ karoti vā kārāpeti vā, tassa anantako
analyzed: potthake āropana dīpakā niṭṭhitā  yaḥ koci paṇḍitaḥ dhīraḥ aṭṭhakathā ādikam gantham karoti vā kārāpeti vā tassa anantakaḥ
translated: [The section on the putting into books is finished.]🔽For whoever is wise and intelligent, whether he composes a text such as a commentary himself or has it composed, his accumulation of merit is immeasurable,

original: hoti puññasaṃcayo, anantako hoti puññānisaṃso. Caturāsīti cetiyasahassa karaṇasadiso,
analyzed: hoti puñña saṃcayaḥ anantakaḥ hoti puñña anisaṃso catur āsīti cetiya sahassa karaṇa sadiso
translated: his benefits from merit are immeasurable, like the making of 84,000 cetiyas.

original: caturāsīti buddharūpasahassa karaṇasadiso, caturāsīti bodhirukkhasahassaropanasadiso,
analyzed: buddha rūpa sahassa karaṇa sadisaḥ catur asīti bodhi rukkha sahassa ropana sadisaḥ
translated: is like making 84,000 Buddha-images, or planting 84,000 Bodhi trees,

original: caturāsīti vihārasahassa karaṇasadiso, yo ca buddhavacanamañjūsaṃ karoti vā kārāpeti
analyzed: karaṇa sadisaḥ yaḥ ca buddha vacana mañjūsam karoti vā
translated: or building 84,000 monasteries, and whoever has the Buddha’s Word written in a beautiful way, or has it written,

original: vā, yo ca buddhavacanaṃ maṇḍanaṃ karoti vā kārāpeti vā, yo ca buddhavacanaṃ lekhaṃ
analyzed: vā yaḥ ca buddha vacanam maṇḍanam karoti vā vā yaḥ ca buddha vacanam lekham
translated: or whoever has the Buddha’s Word written in an ornamental way, or has it written, or whoever has the Buddha’s Word written in letters,

original: karoti vā kārāpeti vā, yo ca potthakaṃ vā, yo ca potthakamūlaṃ vā, deti vā dāpeti🔽vā, yo ca telaṃ vā cuṇṇaṃ vā, dhaññaṃ vā potthakabhañjanatthāya yaṃ kiñci nitthaṃ
analyzed: karoti vā kārāpeti vā yo ca potthakam vā yo ca potthaka mūlam vā deti vā dāpeti  vā yo ca telam vā cuṇṇam vā dhaññam vā potthaka bhañjana tthāya yam kiñci nittham
translated: or has it written, or whoever gives a book, or the price of a book, or oil, or powder, or grain for the making of a book,

original: vā potthakachidde āvunatthāya, yaṃ kiñci suttaṃ vā kaṭṭhaphalakadvayaṃ vā potthakaṃ🔽puṭanatthāya yaṃ kiñci vatthaṃ vā, potthaka-bandhanatthāya, yaṃ kiñci yottaṃ vā potthakalāpa
analyzed: vā potthaka chidde āvunatthāya yam kiñci suttam vā kaṭṭha phalaka dvayam vā potthakam  puṭana tthāya yam kiñci vattham vā potthaka bandhana tthāya yam kiñci yottam vā
translated: or whatever is necessary for filling the holes in a book, or whatever thread, or two pieces of wood, or cloth for making a book,

original: pūṭanatthāya yaṃ kiñci thavikaṃ deti vā dāpeti vā.
analyzed: pūṭana tthāya yam kiñci thavikam deti vā dāpeti vā
translated: or whatever rope for binding a book, or whatever bag for keeping a book, he gives or has it given,

original: Yo ca haritālena vā manosilāya vā, suvaṇṇena vā rajatena vā potthakamaṇḍanaṃ vā kaṭṭhaphalakamaṇḍanaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ ca haritālena vā manosilāya vā suvaṇṇena vā rajatena vā potthaka maṇḍanam vā kaṭṭha phalaka maṇḍanam
translated: Whoever makes a decoration of haritala or of red ochre or of gold or of silver or of a wooden tablet or of a wooden board,

original: vā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, tassa anantako hoti puññasaṃcayo, anantako hoti puññānisaṃso.
analyzed: vā karoti vā kārāpeti vā tassa anantakaḥ hoti puñña saṃcayaḥ anantakaḥ hoti puñña anisaṃso
translated: for him there is an endless heap of merit, there is an endless result of merit.

original: Caturāsīti cetiyasahassa karaṇasadiso, caturāsīti vihārasahassa karaṇasadiso.
analyzed: catur asīti cetiya sahassa karaṇa sadiso catur asīti vihāra sahassa karaṇa sadiso
translated: It is like the making of 84,000 shrines, it is like the making of 84,000 dwellings.

original: Bhave nibbattamāno so, sīlaguṇamupāgatā;
analyzed: bhave nibbattamānaḥ sīla guṇam upāgatā
translated: Having been reborn in an existence, he has come to the virtue of morality;

original: Mahā tejo sadā hoti, sīhanādo visārado.
analyzed: mahā tejaḥ sadā hoti sīha nādaḥ visāra daḥ
translated: he always has great splendour, and is confident like the lion’s roar.

original: Āyuvaṇṇabaluppeto, dhammakāmo bhave saddā;
analyzed: āyu vaṇṇa bala uppetaḥ dhamma kāmaḥ bhave saddā
translated: Endowed with life, beauty and strength, he is one who loves the Dhamma;

original: Devamanussalokesu, mahesakkho anāmayo.
analyzed: deva manussa lokesu mahesakkhaḥ anāmayaḥ
translated: in the worlds of gods and men, he is a great lord, free from disease.

original: Bhave nibbattamāno so, paññavā susamāhito;
analyzed: bhave nibbattamāno so paññavā su samāhito
translated: Having been reborn in an existence, he is wise and well composed;

original: Adhipacca parivāro, sabbasukhādhi gacchati.
analyzed: adhipacca parivāraḥ sabba sukhā adhi gacchati
translated: he goes to the highest happiness, with the requisites and attendants.

original: Saddohīrimā vadaññū, saṃvigga mānaso bhave;
analyzed: vadaññū saṃvigga mānasaḥ bhave
translated: He is one who speaks with a sense of urgency, he is grateful, and in his mind he is full of anxiety;

original: Aṅgapaccaṅga sampanno, āroha pariṇāhavā.
analyzed: sampannaḥ āroha pariṇāhavā
translated: he is endowed with limbs and secondary limbs, and he has height and breadth.

original: Sabbe sattāpi yo loke, sabbattha pūjitābhave;
analyzed: sabbe yaḥ loke sabbattha
translated: All beings in the world, who are worshipped everywhere in existence;

original: Devamanussa sañcaro, mittasahāya pālito.
analyzed: deva manussa sañcaraḥ mitta sahāya pālito
translated: he is protected by friends and companions, in the course of his travels among gods and men.

original: Devamanussa sampattiṃ, anubhoti punappunaṃ;
analyzed: deva manussa sampattim anubhoti punappunaṃ
translated: He will experience again and again the glory of gods and men,

original: Arahatta phalaṃ patto, nibbānaṃ pāpuṇissati.
analyzed: arahatta phalam pattaḥ nibbānam pāpuṇissati
translated: And will attain the fruit of Arahantship and reach Nibbāna.

original: Paṭisambhidā catasso, abhiññā chabbidhe vare;
analyzed: paṭisambhidā catasso abhiññā chabbidhe vare
translated: The four discriminations, the six kinds of high psychic power,

original: Vimokkhe aṭṭhake seṭṭhe, gamissati anāgate.
analyzed: vimokkhe aṭṭhake seṭṭhe gamissati anāgate
translated: And the eight best kinds of deliverance will he attain in the future.

original: Tasmāhi paṇḍito poso, saṃpassaṃ hita mattano;
analyzed: tasmā hi paṇḍitaḥ poso saṃpassam hita mattano
translated: Therefore the wise man, who is desirous of his own welfare,

original: Kāreyya sāma ganthe ca, aññe cāpi kārāpaye.
analyzed: kāreyya sāma ganthe ca aññe ca api kārāpaye
translated: Should have the Sāma and the Gāthā recited, and should have other (texts) recited also.

original: Potthake ca ṭhite ganthe, pāḷi aṭṭhakathādike;
analyzed: potthake ca ṭhite ganthe pāḷi aṭṭhakathā ādike
translated: And when the Gāthās are written down in books, and the texts of the Pāli, the Commentary, etc.,🔽And the Dhammapada,

original: Dhammamañjūsā ganthe ca, lekhaṃ kare kārāpaye.
analyzed: dhamma mañjūsā ganthe ca lekham kare kārāpaye
translated: And the books of the Dhammapada, the price of the books, and the price of the cotton,

original: Potthakaṃ potthakamūlañca, tesaṃ cullathūsampi ca;🔽Pilotikādikaṃ suttaṃ, kaṭṭhaphaladvayamhi ca.
analyzed: potthakam potthakamūlam ca tesam cullathūsam pi ca  pilotikā ādikam suttam kaṭṭha phala dvayamhi ca
translated: And the thread, etc., and the wood and the leaves (for writing on),

original: Dhammabandhanatthāya ca, yaṃ kiñci mahagghaṃ vatthaṃ;
analyzed: dhamma bandhana tthāya ca yam kiñci mahaggham vatthaṃ
translated: And whatever costly cloth there is for the purpose of binding the Dhamma,

original: Dhammabandhanayottañca, yaṃ kiñci thavikampi ca.
analyzed: yam kiñci ca
translated: And whatever binding-material there is for the purpose of binding the Dhamma, and whatever clay there is,

original: Dadeyya dhammakhettamhi, vippassannena cetasā;
analyzed: dadeyya dhamma khettamhi vippassannena cetasā
translated: He should give in the Dhamma-field with a clear mind,

original: Añño cāpi dajjāpeyya, mittasahāyabandhaveti.
analyzed: ca api mitta sahāya bandhavā iti
translated: And let another also cause to be given to friends, companions, and relatives.

original: Ganthākaralekhalekhāpanānisaṃsa dīpanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dīpanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the benefits of the removal of the knots, lines, and scratches is finished.

original: [Iti cūlaganthavaṃse pakiṇṇakadīpako nāma pañcamo paricchedo.]
analyzed: iti cūlagantha vaṃse pakiṇṇakadīpakaḥ nāma pañcamaḥ paricchedo
translated: [Thus ends the fifth chapter in the Minor Chronicle called the “Illumination of the Minor Details.”]

original: Sohaṃ haṃsāraṭṭha jāto, nantapaññoti vissuto
analyzed: saḥ ham haṃsa āraṭṭha jātaḥ nanta paññā iti vissuto
translated: I was born in the country of the swans, and was renowned as the wise Nanda.

original: Saddhā sīla vīrappeto, dhammarasaṃ gavesano.
analyzed: dhamma rasam gavesano
translated: Endowed with faith and virtue and heroism, I was in search of the taste of the Dhamma.

original: Sohaṃ tato gantvā cimaṃ, jina navaṃ yaṃ pūraṃ;
analyzed: tatas gantvā cimam jina navam yam pūram
translated: Having gone from there to this country, which was full of the nine gems of the Jina,

original: Sabba dhammaṃ vicinanto, vīsati vassamāgato.
analyzed: dhammam vicinantaḥ vīsati vassam āgataḥ
translated: I arrived here after twenty years, investigating all the Dhamma.

original: Sabba dhammaṃ vissejjento, kikāre neva bhikkhuno;
analyzed: dhammam vissejjentaḥ na iva bhikkhunaḥ
translated: While investigating all the Dhamma, I split the group of monks who followed the Kikī doctrine,

original: Cha vassānaṃ gaṇaṃ bhitvā, kāmānaṃ abhimaddanaṃ.
analyzed: cha vassānam gaṇam bhitvā kāmānam abhimaddanam
translated: and crushed the lustful monks who were bent on sensual pleasures.

original: Santi sabhā ca nibbānaṃ, gavesiñca punappunaṃ;
analyzed: santi sabhā ca nibbānam gavesiñca punappunam
translated: I sought out the assembly and Nibbāna again and again,🔽and while dwelling in the forest, I composed this small Chronicle of the Three Baskets,

original: Vasantohaṃ, vanārammaṃ, piṭakattaya saṅgahaṃ;🔽Ganthavaṃsaṃ imaṃ khuddaṃ, ariyasaṅghadāsakanti.
analyzed: vana ārammam saṅgaham  ganthavaṃsam imam khuddam ariya saṅgha dāsakam ti
translated: called the “Servant of the Noble Sangha,” which is a collection of the minor details.

original: Iti pāmojjatthāya araññavāsinā, nandapaññācariyena kato cūḷaganthavaṃso niṭṭhito.
analyzed: iti pāmojjatthāya arañña vāsinā nandapaññācariyena kato cūḷagantha vaṃso niṭṭhito
translated: Thus the Minor Chronicle was composed by the forest-dwelling teacher Nandapañña for the purpose of rejoicing. It is finished.

original: Dhammavaṭaṃsakanāmena visuto thero, yaṃ pakaraṇaṃ likkhitaṃ taṃ paripuṇṇaṃ tena puññena taṃ piṭakaṃ parisippaṃ pariniṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: dhammavaṭaṃsaka nāmena visutaḥ theraḥ yam pakaraṇam likkhitam tam paripuṇṇam tena puññena tam piṭakam parisippam pariniṭṭhitam
translated: The learned Elder named Dhammavaṭṭasaka, who wrote the treatise, by the merit of that, completed the Basket.

original: Mameva sissasamūhānañca parisippaṃ pariniṭṭhitaṃ. Tave sissānū sissāni ca, parisippaṃ pariniṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: mama eva sissa samūhānam ca parisippam pariniṭṭhitam tave sissānū sissāni ca parisippam pariniṭṭhitam
translated: The completion of the Basket was completed for me and my group of disciples. The completion of the Basket was completed for your disciples and their disciples.

original: Cūḷaganthavaṃso niṭṭhito.
analyzed: cūḷagantha vaṃsaḥ niṭṭhito
translated: The Minor Collection is finished.
